meta.title: Ventura Unified School District > Staff Closure Information

li.class: edsmm_menuItem edsmm_first edsmm_hasChild edsmm_megaMenu edsmm_multiColumn edsmm_4Column edsmm_pageWidth

div.p: This page is for our VUSD employees to obtain the latest access to the most up to date information during this pandemic. We want to begin by thanking all of our dedicated VUSD employees who have assisted in keeping our students as healthy as possible over the last few weeks. We also want to thank all of those employees who will be called upon in the next few months to assist in ensuring we continue to monitor the virus, reevaluate our situation and work on various projects/programs during the closure.

In the interest of the health of our community, the Ventura Unified School District Board of Education and Superintendent have decided to close all VUSD schools beginning Monday, March 16 through Thursday, June 11, 2020.

ul.li: all VUSD TK-12 schools
VUSD preschool programs
VUSD supported after-school programs
and Ventura Adult and Continuing Education (VACE).

div.p: All Ventura County School Districts, including VUSD, agreed to keep campuses closed through the end of the school year in support of the coronavirus mitigation effort. The decision was made in consultation with Ventura County Public Health Officer, Dr. Robert Levin. It comes after recommendations from California Governor Gavin Newsom and California Superintendent of Public Instruction Tony Thurmond for schools to continue providing distance learning in lieu of in-class instruction for the remainder of the current semester. To be clear, the 2019/20 school year is not over. It has transitioned from in-person classroom instruction to distance learning for the rest of this academic year.

p.a: Governor Newsom Signs Executive Order Ensuring State Funding for Schools Even in Event of Physical Closure- Published: Mar 13, 2020

div.div: Dr. Jeff Davis Communication to Staff on Fri. March 13, 2020

div.p: We will be distributing on Mondays from 11: 30 am- 1 pm at the six sites listed below.

We have seen a significant increase in the needs for meals and are making adjustments to our orders to fill these needs. However, due to the rise in the number of meals that some families have requested, we do need to limit the number of meals one family can pick up. That limit will be five meal packs (breakfast and lunch) for children ages 1-18. We ask that each family only take what they need for the children in their household. We do realize this may impact some that are picking up for neighbors, etc. however, this is the only way we can do our best to provide for all children in need and not require students be in attendance to pick up.
Meals are staple items for both breakfast and lunch and are first come, first serve. Please follow these food safety guidelines found on our website.

Keep refrigerated items refrigerated. Example: milk, string cheese. Keep frozen items either refrigerated or frozen until heating for consumption. Example: burrito, corn dog. Heat items fully for consumption.. Rinse fresh fruit or produce items before consumption.. Discard any items that have reached an expiration date.Discard any leftovers by end of day Friday.Meals items are subject to change due to availability of products.
We will continue to evaluate our program and notify you of any changes we need to make to the policy as we move forward.

1. Atlas Elementary School 760 Jazmin Avenue, Ventura
2. Montalvo Elementary 2050 Grand Avenue, Ventura
3. Will Rogers Elementary 316 Howard Street, Ventura
4. Data Middle School 2060 Cameron Street, Ventura
5. Sheridan Way Elementary 573 Sheridan Way, Ventura
6. Sunset K-8 School 400 Sunset Ave., Oak View

The Ventura Unified School District, VUEA and VESPA agreed on a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) for the district to provide a one-time, non-precedent setting retirement incentive program for all employees who will be age 63 or over by December 31, 2020 and who have a minimum of 10 years of service with the district (full-time or part-time service, and years do not have to be continuous.) This program is being offered to assist these employees in purchasing their own medical insurance in exchange for their irrevocable retirement. Those who already submitted their retirement through the 2019-2020 Early Tell offer are also eligible to apply for this program, as long as they have not yet separated from district service.
The signed MOU’s for each bargaining unit are attached to this email. Please read the MOU that pertains to your association.
Below is a summary of some key information as outlined in the MOU’s.

p.strong: Bargaining Unit (VESPA), Confidential and Classified Management

td.p: Benefits are limited to the number of participants in each employee group as follows:

ul.li: VUEA: 30 participants
Management: 5 participants total*

td.p: * a total of five slots will be offered to management employees (Certificated and Classified combined)
Employees who apply and meet the qualification requirements will be accepted into the program, based on the date/time forms are received.

Certificated employees need to complete the attached participation form and email completed form to the Certificated Human Resources Department. Forms will be date and time stamped when received by the Certificated Human Resources Department.
Benefits are limited to the number of participants in each employee group as follows:

ul.li: VESPA: 30 participants
Classified Confidential: 3 participants
Management: 5 participants total*

td.p: * a total of five slots will be offered to management employees (Certificated and Classified combined)
Employees who apply and meet the qualification requirements will be accepted into the program, based on the date/time forms are received.
All Classified employees: Use the link below to apply. The provided Google questionnaire form will be date and time stamped when submitted.

p.strong: When does my form need to be submitted?
When does my form need to be submitted:

td.p: You will need to email your intent to apply and completed form NO LATER THAN MAY 8, 2020.
You will need to complete the Google doc form and submit NO LATER THAN APRIL 22, 2020.

p.strong: What benefit programs are being offered?
What benefit programs are being offered?

td.p: There are two programs available as follows:
For VUEA bargaining unit members or certificated management employees age 63 up to age 65.
For VUEA bargaining unit members or certificated management employees age 65 and over.
There are two programs available as follows:
For VESPA bargaining unit members, Confidential or classified management employees age 63 up to age 65.
For VESPA bargaining unit members, Confidential or classified management employees age 65 and over.

p.strong: Who is eligible for Program #1, what would my benefit be, and what are the requirements?
Who is eligible for Program #1, what would my benefit be, and what are the requirements?

ul.li: Must be a current, active employee with VUSD.
Must be at least age 63 as of December 31, 2020.
Must have a minimum of 10 years of service with the district immediately prior to the effective date of retirement (full-time or part-time service, and years do not have to be continuous).

td.p: Total payments are for a maximum of 24 monthly payments, effective from the retirement date as follows:

ul.li: If employee retires at age 63 up to age 65, the District shall pay $750 per month toward the employee’s purchase of his/her own medical insurance from the date of retirement to age 65. Upon turning 65, the monthly amount will be adjusted to $400 per month.
The first monthly check will be distributed to the employee no later than the last day of the month following their retirement date.
Payments will be discontinued upon the employee’s death.

td.p: Employee may elect to receive a one-time lump sum payment for the full amount as outlined above instead of electing to receive a monthly payment for 24 months. This lump sum payment would be paid to the employee no later than 30 days following their date of retirement.

ul.li: Must submit application for your irrevocable retirement and resignation by 4:00pm on MAY 8, 2020.
Retirement must be effective no later than July 30, 2020.

Must be officially accepted into the State Teachers Retirement System (STRS) or the Public Employees Retirement System (PERS) prior to receiving the benefit. Acceptance shall be defined as monthly receipt of retirement income from STRS or PERS. Verification to the Certificated Human Resources Department shall be the responsibility of the retiree.
Must be a current, active employee with VUSD.
Must be at least age 63 as of December 31, 2020.
Must have a minimum of 10 years of service with the district immediately prior to the effective date of retirement (full-time or part-time service, and years do not have to be continuous).

td.p: Total payments are for a maximum of 24 monthly payments, effective from the retirement date as follows:

ul.li: If employee retires at age 63 up to age 65, the District shall pay $750 per month toward the employee’s purchase of his/her own medical insurance from the date of retirement to age 65. Upon turning 65, the monthly amount will be adjusted to $400 per month.
The first monthly check will be distributed to the employee no later than the last day of the month following their retirement date.
Monthly amounts will be prorated based on the employee’s current FTE (full-time equivalent based on 40 hours per week)
30 - 40 hours/week = 100% monthly amount
20 - 29.75 hours/week = 75% monthly amount
1.25 - 19.75 hours/week = 50% monthly amount
Payments will be discontinued upon the employee’s death.

td.p: Employee may elect to receive a one-time lump sum payment for the full amount as outlined above instead of electing to receive a monthly payment for 24 months. This lump sum payment would be paid to the employee no later than 30 days following their date of retirement.

ul.li: Must submit application for your irrevocable retirement and resignation by 4:00pm on APRIL 22, 2020.
Retirement must be effective no later than December 31, 2020.

Must be officially accepted into the Public Employees Retirement System (PERS) or the State Teachers Retirement System (STRS) prior to receiving the benefit. Acceptance shall be defined as monthly receipt of retirement income from PERS or STRS. Verification to the Classified Human Resources Department shall be the responsibility of the retiree.

p.strong: Who is eligible for Program #2, what would my benefit be, and what are the requirements?
Who is eligible for Program #2, what would my benefit be, and what are the requirements?

ul.li: Must be a current, active employee with VUSD.
Must be at least age 65.
Must have a minimum of 10 years of service with the district immediately prior to the effective date of retirement (full-time or part-time service, and years do not have to be continuous).

td.p: Total payments are for a maximum of 24 monthly payments, effective from the retirement date as follows:

ul.li: If employee retires at age 65 or over, the District shall pay $400 per month toward the employee’s purchase of his/her own medical insurance for a maximum payment period of 24 months, effective from the date of retirement.
The first monthly check will be distributed to the employee no later than the last day of the month following their retirement date.
Payments will be discontinued upon the employee’s death.

td.p: Employee may elect to receive a one-time lump sum payment for the full amount as outlined above instead of electing to receive a monthly payment for 24 months. This lump sum payment would be paid to the employee no later than 30 days following their date of retirement.

ul.li: Must submit application for your irrevocable retirement and resignation by 4:00pm on MAY 8, 2020.
Retirement must be effective no later than July 30, 2020.

Must be officially accepted into the State Teachers Retirement System (STRS) or the Public Employees Retirement System (PERS) prior to receiving the benefit. Acceptance shall be defined as monthly receipt of retirement income from STRS or PERS. Verification to the Certificated Human Resources Department shall be the responsibility of the retiree.
Must be a current, active employee with VUSD.
Must be at least age 65.
Must have a minimum of 10 years of service with the district immediately prior to the effective date of retirement (full-time or part-time service, and years do not have to be continuous).

td.p: Total payments are for a maximum of 24 monthly payments, effective from the retirement date as follows:

ul.li: If employee retires at age 65 or over, the District shall pay $400 per month toward the employee’s purchase of his/her own medical insurance for a maximum payment period of 24 months, effective from the date of retirement.
The first monthly check will be distributed to the employee no later than the last day of the month following their retirement date.
Monthly amounts will be prorated based on the employee’s current FTE (full-time equivalent based on 40 hours per week)
30 - 40 hours/week = 100% monthly amount
20 - 29.75 hours/week = 75% monthly amount
1.25 - 19.75 hours/week = 50% monthly amount
Payments will be discontinued upon the employee’s death.

td.p: Employee may elect to receive a one-time lump sum payment for the full amount as outlined above instead of electing to receive a monthly payment for 24 months. This lump sum payment would be paid to the employee no later than 30 days following their date of retirement.

ul.li: Must submit application for your irrevocable retirement and resignation by 4:00pm on APRIL 22, 2020.
Retirement must be effective no later than December 31, 2020.

Must be officially accepted into the Public Employees Retirement System (PERS) or the State Teachers Retirement System (STRS) prior to receiving the benefit. Acceptance shall be defined as monthly receipt of retirement income from PERS or STRS. Verification to the Classified Human Resources Department shall be the responsibility of the retiree.

td.p: You must apply by 4:00pm on May 8, 2020

The form you must complete is attached to this email. You must complete and email this form - “Retirement Benefit Assist Program Participation Form Fillable” to Certificated Human Resources, attention Sherry Manley
You must apply by 4:00pm on April 22, 2020

p.strong: What if I can’t email my form, can I drop off a hard copy of my completed form to the ESC?
What if I don’t have access to the link above, or am having problems completing the questionnaire? Can I pick up a form from the ESC and submit it?

td.p: Yes. Maria Lopez, our District Receptionist will be available Monday-Friday at 10am each day if you need to drop off your completed form to the ESC located at 255 W. Stanley Avenue, Ventura 93001
*Please note, Maria, will not be working at the ESC the week of Spring break (April 6-10)
Yes. Maria Lopez, our District Receptionist will be available Monday-Friday at 10am each day if you need to drop off your completed form to the ESC located at 255 W. Stanley Avenue, Ventura 93001
*Please note, Maria, will not be working at the ESC the week of Spring break (April 6-10)
You will need to leave a message, and staff will return your call.
You will need to leave a message, and staff will return your call.

p.strong: How can I contact STRS to find out about my retirement benefits?
How can I contact PERS to find out about my retirement benefits?

td.p:
Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
Closed on state holidays.
